segments.key_quote: Krishna himself manifests as the sound.

Just like our body is tiny consciousness, this sound has got infinite consciousness.

segments.key_quote: Therefore the holy name first shines pure satya, chitta and ananda energy.

segments.key_quote: When our heart is cleansed, as I said, Lord is absolute. There is no difference between His reflection and Him.

segments.transcript: So, we worship Shakti Avesha Nama, so that Chetodharpanam happens. When our heart is cleansed, as I said, Lord is absolute. There is no difference between His reflection and Him. Then Saranagati Bhavana, chant and hear with total surrender of your heart to the Lord. I am yours, do what you want with me. My life, my existence, everything is yours. I do not belong to me. In that, remember Krishna is saying, Sarva Dharmaan Paritya Jamam Ekam, Saranam Paritya Sarva Dharmaan Paritya Jamam Ekam, Saranam Praja. Surrender unto the Nama. Yes, that Krishna has come, each tongue has come to receive your surrender. Surrender Bhavana, Saranagati.

segments.key_quote: Chant and hear with Kripa Apeksha Bhavana, chant 108 beats, your heart should be craving for Krishna's mercy.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Kripa Apeksha Bhavana, emphasizing the importance of begging for Krishna's mercy to overcome material attachments and return to Godhead.
segments.transcript: Chant and hear with Saranagati Bhavana. Then practice Kripa Apeksha Bhavana, chant 108 beats, your heart should be craving for Krishna's mercy. Only by Krishna's mercy we can get out of this material world. Only by Krishna's mercy of Chitta we can come out of this trap that, I am this body. Only I can, by Krishna's Kripa, Kripa Apexha, so Kripa Apexha for Satyachati, Chittashakti, Anandashakti. Yes. Yes. Chant and hear with Kripa Apeksha. Apeksha means begging. Beg for enlightenment. Beg for service. Beg for rejoining with the Lord back to Godhead. Beg for attachment to Holy Name. Beg for addiction to chanting the Holy Name. So Kripa Apeksha Mala.

segments.key_quote: Feeling that there is no hope. I am hopeless without your mercy.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Nama Ashraya, emphasizing the importance of seeking shelter in the holy name, and Vinamrita Mala, emphasizing the importance of chanting with humility and dependence on the Lord.
segments.transcript: Then there is Nama Ashraya. The feeling of the shelter. Feeling that there is no hope. I am hopeless without your mercy. And then the Lord's Ashraya. You become recipient of Lord's Ashraya. When you depend upon His Ashraya. So the whole 108 beats of chanting and hearing. Begging shelter of the ocean of Nama. Ocean of Satchitananda. The infinite, unconditional, loving Nama Prabhu. You are seeking His shelter. Nama Ashraya Japa. 108 beats. Then you have Vinamrita Mala. You have to practice that humility with which one should chant. Prabhupada says anybody who chants Hare Krishna with great material satisfaction that everything is wonderful for me. His quality of Japa is very low. Nothing is wonderful in this world. Anything and everything can slip out any moment. So one should understand the nature of this material world. Chant helplessly. Chant dependently. Be humble. I am possessionless. Everything I have can go in a second. You are my real possession. You are my real possession. You give. You take. You give and take everything. And I have full faith that whatever you give, whatever you take is all for my good. And chant in a humble state of mind as a weak living entity. Weak against conquering Maya. Weak in all aspects. And strong only by the mercy of the Nama Prabhu. Oh! So.

segments.key_quote: Humility is also about how you relate with other children of Krishna. Every living entity is part and parcel of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker expands on the concept of humility, emphasizing the importance of respectful dealings with all living entities, not just devotees.
segments.transcript: So that is Vinamrita Japa. Remember Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's Humility is not only before the Lord. Humility is also about how you relate with other children of Krishna. Every living entity is part and parcel of Krishna. Unless we have respectful dealings with other devotees, unless we have respectful dealings with other devotees, unless we have respectful dealings with other devotees, not only devotees, with due respect for every living entity, the taste of Nama will not come. So therefore, Chaitanya Mahaprabhu says, you make a garland of this verse, and wear it on your neck, so that you always remember that, I should be humble. Humble not only before the Lord, humble before all living entities. Means giving due respect to all living entities. So Vinamrita Japa.

segments.key_quote: Always remembering that Krishna is my only maintainer.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Bhartapatra Japa, emphasizing the importance of remembering that Krishna is the only maintainer, and Raksha Patra, emphasizing that Krishna is the only protector.
segments.transcript: Then there is Bhartapatra Japa. Always remembering that Krishna is my only maintainer. Gop Trithye Varanam. That Krishna is my maintainer. You have full confidence, you have full faith, you have no anxieties of how. His material world is full of anxieties. In the material world, anxiety even to maintain even material body. So every material and spiritual, spiritually Krishna is my maintainer. This Nama Prabhu whom I am worshipping, He is my maintainer. With gratitude you recognize that He is the maintainer. That I am the Bhartapatra. Bharta means care from Krishna. Patra means I am the recipient of the care of Krishna everyday. Every aspect of my life. Raksha Patra. I am the recipient of protection of Krishna. I exist safely only because Nama Prabhu is protecting me, Krishna is protecting me. So 108 beads in this attitude of Krishna, you are my only protector. You are my only protector. Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare. Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare. Feeling. These are not speaking. Bhavana means the language of, you speak in the language of emotions. You speak in the language of feeling. Feeling Saranagati. Feeling Kripa Apeksha. Feeling Charanashraya. Feeling Vinamrita. Feeling Bhartapatra. Feeling Raksha Patra.

segments.key_quote: Gratitude to the Lord for everything. For everything he has given me, everything he has not given me, for everything he has taken away from me, I am eternally grateful to Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Krita Jnata, emphasizing the importance of expressing gratitude to Krishna for everything, both given and taken away.
segments.transcript: And then, you have, the next mala you have to practice is Krita Jnata. Gratitude to the Lord for everything. For everything he has given me, everything he has not given me, for everything he has taken away from me, I am eternally grateful to Krishna. You are grateful to Krishna for, coming on your tongue, permitting you to chant his name, and entering your heart, and shining the Satchidananda in your heart. I am grateful to Nama Prabhu. So like this, everything, for spiritual intelligence, you are grateful. Everything that you have is coming from Nama Prabhu. All Kripa, Nama Prabhu, grateful to Nama Prabhu, for giving you transcendental knowledge, giving you transcendental detachment, saving you from this material world, giving you daily Japa Seva, giving you devotional service, giving you opportunity to participate in the mission of Nama Avatara. So, Krita Jnata Mala, 108 beats.

segments.key_quote: Begging forgiveness from the Lord, for not treating him with respect, attention, for though he has appeared on my tongue.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Kshama Apeksha, emphasizing the importance of begging forgiveness from the Lord, and Seva Apeksha, emphasizing the importance of begging for service to Krishna.
segments.transcript: Whatever naturally comes, don't have to think. You cannot think during Japa. Thinking activity slowly takes you away into something else. Whatever feeling of Krita Jnata you get, enough. Even one thought is enough. One thought feeling, one bhavana is enough. Like Sharanagati, one word is enough. Yes, I am yours my Lord. Do whatever you want with me. I do not belong to myself. I am your slave. That feeling, one feeling is enough, 108 beats of Sharanagati, 108 beats of Bhartapatra, these are all such simple natural feelings between devotee and God. These are all natural feelings. Kshama Apeksha, next, begging forgiveness from the Lord, for not treating him with respect, attention, for though he has appeared on my tongue. Beg forgiveness for all mechanical chanting, please forgive me my Lord for mechanical chanting, for not recognizing that you are a person who are before me, you have come very mercifully. Beg forgiveness for not recognizing his love for you. Beg forgiveness for neglecting him. That is Kshama Apeksha. Then Seva Apeksha, 16th Mala, Seva Apeksha, begging for service. Either we can serve Maya or we can serve Krishna. We have to serve, there is no doubt. Nobody can keep quiet. So, you are begging Nama Prabhu, keep me under your service, away from Maya's service. This way we complete our 16 rounds.

segments.key_quote: So this is the essence of soulful Japa. And how much you can perfect, there is no end to it, how much you can perfect.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by summarizing the essence of soulful japa and emphasizing its potential for endless perfection as a relationship with Nama Prabhu.
segments.transcript: So this is the essence of soulful Japa. And how much you can perfect, there is no end to it, how much you can perfect. These are all drops of how wonderful Japa can be of 16 rounds as a relationship with Nama Prabhu. Hare Krishna.
